column1: Yara is a small town and municipality in the Granma Province of Cuba
column2: located halfway between the cities of Bayamo and Manzanillo
column3: in the Gulf of Guacanayabo. Yara means "place" in the Taíno language.

column1: The Taíno Cacique (chief) Hatuey was burnt at the stake in Yara
column4: after he organized a guerrilla war against the Spaniards. Hatuey is known as "Cuba's First National Hero". This action gave birth to one of Cuban mayor's myths; "La Luz de Yara"
column7: the beginning of the Ten Years' War in Cuba occurred and is known as El Grito de Yara (The Cry of Yara) and was the beginning of the First Cuban War of Independence.
